articles.headline: Shares Soar on Retail Data; 2 Wall Street Records
articles.snippet: Wall Street soared today, propelling the Standard & Poor’s 500 index and Dow Jones industrials to record highs.
articles.abstract: Wall Street soared today, propelling the Standard & Poor’s 500 index and Dow Jones industrials to record highs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wall Street shot past two milestones yesterday as the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index and the Dow Jones industrial average hit records.

articles.headline: A Chinese Reformer Betrays His Cause, and Pays
articles.snippet: The Chinese regulator who was executed Tuesday was corrupted by the system he sought to change.
articles.abstract: The Chinese regulator who was executed Tuesday was corrupted by the system he sought to change.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING, July 12  — Zheng Xiaoyu once ranked as one of the most powerful regulators in China. He rose from modest beginnings to help create and lead Beijing’s version of the Food and Drug Administration in the United States.

articles.headline: Low-Cost Chinese Cars Making Restrained Entry to European Market
articles.snippet: Aided by a weak dollar, China is quietly entering the European auto market in the first test of rich markets by Chinese automakers
articles.abstract: Aided by a weak dollar, China is quietly entering the European auto market in the first test of rich markets by Chinese automakers
articles.lead_paragraph: PALAZZOLO SULL’OGLIO, Italy — They have names like the Brilliance BS6, the Landwind Fashion or the improbable Hover Wingle, and though these sedans, vans and sport utility vehicles are hardly as familiar to Europeans as, say, a Volkswagen Golf, they are beginning to show up on European roads.

articles.headline: Business Casual
articles.snippet: Allen & Company’s annual summit, being held this week in Sun Valley, Idaho, brings together some of media and entertainment’s biggest moguls.
articles.abstract: Allen & Company’s annual summit, being held this week in Sun Valley, Idaho, brings together some of media and entertainment’s biggest moguls.
articles.lead_paragraph: As an environment for access to business information, Allen & Company’s annual summit meeting this week in Sun Valley, Idaho, leaves a little to be desired.

articles.headline: Alcan Gets $38 Billion Takeover Bid
articles.snippet: The $101-a-share Rio Tinto bid represents a 32.8 percent premium to Alcoa’s hostile offer of $76.03 a share, potentially making it difficult for Alcoa to increase its bid.
articles.abstract: The $101-a-share Rio Tinto bid represents a 32.8 percent premium to Alcoa’s hostile offer of $76.03 a share, potentially making it difficult for Alcoa to increase its bid.
articles.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL, July 12 — The mining company Rio Tinto made a sizable and friendly $38.1 billion offer for Alcan, the Canadian aluminum producer, on Thursday, easily pushing aside an earlier $27.5 billion hostile bid from Alcoa.

articles.headline: Bush Distorts Qaeda Links, Critics Assert
articles.snippet: The president’s references to Al Qaeda in Mesopotamia as the group that attacked the United States in 2001 have oversimplified the nature of the insurgency in Iraq.
articles.abstract: The president’s references to Al Qaeda in Mesopotamia as the group that attacked the United States in 2001 have oversimplified the nature of the insurgency in Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, July 12 — In rebuffing calls to bring troops home from Iraq, President Bush on Thursday employed a stark and ominous defense. “The same folks that are bombing innocent people in Iraq,” he said, “were the ones who attacked us in America on September the 11th, and that’s why what happens in Iraq matters to the security here at home.”
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Tax Loopholes Sweeten a Deal for Blackstone
articles.snippet: The Blackstone Group, the big buyout firm, has devised a way for its partners to avoid paying taxes on $3.7 billion.
articles.abstract: The Blackstone Group, the big buyout firm, has devised a way for its partners to avoid paying taxes on $3.7 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Blackstone Group, the big buyout firm, has devised a way for its partners to effectively avoid paying taxes on $3.7 billion, the bulk of what it raised last month from selling shares to the public.
